data.text:
Weather overview

The city of Madrid, nestled in Spain, experiences a temperate continental climate, characterized by mild fluctuations in temperature throughout the year. The typical daytime temperatures range from a brisk 10Â Â°CÂ (51Â Â°F) in January to a warm 33Â Â°CÂ (91Â Â°F) in July. Madrid's skies are driest in July, with a mere 2Â days of precipitation observed, while the most plentiful rainfall occurs in April, reaching up to 8Â days. When night falls, the temperatures can dip to a cool 3Â Â°CÂ (37Â Â°F) in January and rise to a comfortable 19Â Â°CÂ (65Â Â°F) in July. The city also enjoys an array of sunny hours, with the sunlight hours increasing as the year progresses.

January weather

In January, Madrid witnesses its lowest daytime temperature, a chilly 10Â Â°CÂ (51Â Â°F), alongside the minimum nocturnal temperature of 3Â Â°CÂ (37Â Â°F). Rainfall begins to decrease, amounting to 32Â mmÂ (1.25Â in). The city welcomes additional sunlit hours which now average 4Â hours. The winds remain gentle, blowing at a lowly 2.

February weather

February in Madrid is marked by a noticeable increase in sunlight hours, averaging 5Â hours. One might also witness a subtle rise in daytime temperatures, which sit at 13Â Â°CÂ (55Â Â°F).

March weather

As spring approaches, March sees a reduction in the number of rainy days in Madrid. Meanwhile, the night temperatures gently rise to an average of 6Â Â°CÂ (43Â Â°F), paralleling the climb of daytime temperatures to 17Â Â°CÂ (62Â Â°F). Sunlight hours continue their upward trend, now reaching 6Â hours.

April weather

April finds Madrid at the peak of its rainy season, with an average of 8Â days of rain. The daytime temperature continues its ascent, now at 19Â Â°CÂ (66Â Â°F), and the pleasant trend is also seen in nighttime temperatures with an average of 7Â Â°CÂ (45Â Â°F). Sunlight hours extend further, now totaling 7Â hours. However, wind speed also reaches its zenith at 3.

May weather

The onset of May in Madrid brings a decrease in the number of rainy days, averaging 8Â days. The warmth of the day temperature, similar to previous months, climbs to 23Â Â°CÂ (73Â Â°F), and the nocturnal warmth parallels, registering at 11Â Â°CÂ (52Â Â°F). An increase in sunlit hours is noted as well, at 8Â hours.

June weather

By June, Madrid's daytime temperature escalates to 29Â Â°CÂ (84Â Â°F), heralding the start of the tourist season. Concurrently, there's a diminishing count of rainy days, now reported at 4Â days, and a tapering of rainfall, with the amount at 21Â mmÂ (0.84Â in). As the tourist season kicks off, sun hours increase steadily, akin to the preceding months, and the days attain their maximum length.

July weather

July celebrates the peak of daytime temperatures in Madrid, a sweltering 33Â Â°CÂ (91Â Â°F), while also observing the highest nighttime temperatures, averaging 19Â Â°CÂ (65Â Â°F). The scant number of rainy days, at 2Â days, denotes the driest part of the year, with rainfall amounts similarly receding. Prolonged sunlit hours become the norm, averaging 11Â hours.

August weather

As August unfolds, the scorching daytime temperatures begin a subtle decline to 32Â Â°CÂ (89Â Â°F) in Madrid. The pervasive tourist season continues, complemented by a minimum in rainfall amounts recorded at 10Â mmÂ (0.38Â in). Sunlight hours start their descent, now averaging 11Â hours.

September weather

September brings a mild decrease in Madrid's daytime temperatures, now at an average of 27Â Â°CÂ (80Â Â°F), and a downturn in night temperatures is also evident. Rainy days exhibit a slight uptick, equating to 4Â days, and rain accumulation witnesses a gradual rise. The count of sunlight hours continues its decline, currently at 8Â hours.

October weather

October in Madrid sees a continual increase in rainy days, which now stand at 7Â days, while the height of rainfall accumulation can be noted. The fallback in daily temperatures now registers at 20Â Â°CÂ (68Â Â°F), and the decrease in nighttime temperatures mirrors the previous month's, remaining steady at 11Â Â°CÂ (51Â Â°F). The dwindling number of sunlit hours is again apparent, currently standing at 6Â hours.

November weather

November observes a continued increase in number of rainy days, quantified at 8Â days in Madrid. The nocturnal temperatures dip again to an average of 6Â Â°CÂ (43Â Â°F), while the general decline of the daytime temperatures continues, now at 14Â Â°CÂ (58Â Â°F). As sun exposure diminishes, the hours register 5Â hours.

December weather

As the year closes, December in Madrid manifests a further dip in both daytime, averaging 11Â Â°CÂ (51Â Â°F), and night temperatures, resting at 4Â Â°CÂ (38Â Â°F). Additionally, the proliferation of rainy days begins to taper, correlated with the peak in humidity, reaching 75Â % in the city. The span of daylight reaches its minimum, and the paucity of sunny hours is also marked, averaging 4Â hours.
